title: How to Install Opera Browser Through Terminal on Ubuntu

steps.title: To add Opera’s public key, first press Ctrl+Alt+T on your keyboard to open Terminal.
steps.content: To add Opera’s public key, first press Ctrl+Alt+T on your keyboard to open Terminal. When it opens, type or use copy/paste method to add following command: sudo sh -c 'wget -O - http://deb.opera.com/archive.key | apt-key add -' and hit Enter.

steps.title: When it asks password, type password and hit Enter again.
steps.content: When it asks password, type password and hit Enter again.

steps.title: Now to add Opera repository type or use copy/paste method to add following command:
steps.content: Now to add Opera repository type or use copy/paste method to add following command: sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list.d/opera.list and hit Enter.

steps.title: When Gedit show's up, copy this line to Opera list:
steps.content: When Gedit show's up, copy this line to Opera list: deb http://deb.opera.com/opera/ stable non-free then save it and close Gedit.

steps.title: After you close Gedit, type or copy/paste following command to the Terminal, to update your system:
steps.content: After you close Gedit, type or copy/paste following command to the Terminal, to update your system: sudo apt-get update and hit Enter.

steps.title: To install Opera, type or use copy/paste method to add following command:
steps.content: To install Opera, type or use copy/paste method to add following command: sudo apt-get install opera-stable and hit Enter.

steps.title: When it asks you that do you want to continue, type 'Y' to the Terminal and hit Enter.
steps.content: When it asks you that do you want to continue, type 'Y' to the Terminal and hit Enter.

steps.title: After Opera browser are installed, now close your Terminal.
steps.content: After Opera browser are installed, now close your Terminal.

steps.title: To run Opera browser, press window key (key beside Alt key) to open Dash and type 'op' to search function, then click with your mouse on icon.
steps.content: To run Opera browser, press window key (key beside Alt key) to open Dash and type 'op' to search function, then click with your mouse on icon.

steps.title: If you want, read Opera Software End-User License, then click on 'I Agree' button with your mouse.
steps.content: If you want, read Opera Software End-User License, then click on 'I Agree' button with your mouse.

steps.title: Now, you're ready to use Opera 56 browser.
steps.content: Now, you're ready to use Opera 56 browser.
